text: Dominican Republic was first at the Olympic Games in 1964. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for the Dominican Republic is DOM. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Teams from the Dominican Republic have competed in the Summer Olympic Games. None have gone to the Winter Olympic Games. The country has won six medals in all. ==List of medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event Pedro Nolasco 1984 Los Angeles Boxing Bantamweight Félix Sánchez 2004 Athens Athletics Men's 400 metre hurdles Manuel Felix Diaz 2008 Beijing Boxing Light welterweight Yulis Gabriel Mercedes 2008 Beijing Taekwondo Men's 58 kg Félix Sánchez 2012 London Athletics Men's 400 m hurdles Luguelín Santos 2012 London Athletics Men's 400 m ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Dominican republic profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in the Dominican Republic Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of the Dominican Republic
title: Dominican Republic at the Olympics
